p: Symptom scales were commonly used to examine mental health outcomes. Distress ( n = 17) was one of the most investigated outcomes; primarily psychological distress measured using the K10. Some studies attempted to develop specific environmental distress measures, including a scale for solastalgia and a specific ‘climate change distress’ scale [ 41, 46, 47, 48]. Four studies used validated screening tools for mental disorders [ 39, 41, 45, 46]. Only one study used a structured diagnostic instrument to determine mental disorder diagnoses [ 49].
